job_title: Registered Practical Nurse in Toronto, ON
pros: - opportunity to work in Recovery Area, and see different procedures done, - gained a lot of experience with IV
cons: - no parking, nightmare to find street parking, you will get bunch of tickets and will be required to walk 1-1.5km. - inconsistent schedule, you’ll be expected to work different shifts starting from 5:30am to 3pm, - mandatory on-calls waking you up 3am, - old equipment, dirty old hospital, - no food options in hospital, - nobody cares about nurses, management fills staffing lounges with old furniture which looks like literal infection hazard, - pay is below average, you have to put in 650h of work, then they will review your letter of experience, and never pay you retroactively.

job_title: Mental Health Outreach in Toronto, ON
pros:
Toronto East General Hospital values its employees and, as such, has excellent benefits and time off policies.
There are many creative job opportunities, if you have the ability to be somewhat flexible and want to try something different.  Most of the staff are very positive and seem to genuinely like their work and the hospital itself as an employer.   Salaries are very generous compared to other programs, etc.
cons: The cons to the work that I have done is that it involves weekends and statutory holidays (as a member of "The Assertive Community Treatment Team" we cover ALL  holidays and weekends as our service is 24/ 7, 365 days of the year).  Some the shifts are very long (7 or 8 work days in a row with only 2 days off afterwards).    I would like to have more opportunities to attend outside training events and conferences but funds are very limited which is prohibitive in terms of
